header.title: Pixelizer
header.description: {title} allows you to create glitchy images by resorting their pixel content. This trinket is free for use and fully open source.

main.fileSelectExplanation: Select or drag an image file ( JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP ) here to get started
main.privacy: Your images will load into your browser's memory for this session and will not be uploaded anywhere.

errors.unsupportedFile: Could not open file, it is not of the supported image type

description.angle: Angle (in degrees) determining the sorting direction
description.randomness: Percentage of pixels NOT to sort (0% = fully sorted, 100% = no sorting)
description.charLength: Characteristic length for the randomized width generation
description.sortingType: The algorithm used to sort the pixels
description.intervalFunction: The algorithm used to calculate the intervals between pixels
description.lowerThreshold: How dark a pixel must be to be considered a border for sorting
description.upperThreshold: How bright a pixel must be to be considered as a border for sorting
description.useMask: Load an additional image to use as a mask for the sorted pixels
description.useAsBase: Allows you to stack filtered output (this clears state history)
